item.title: Balaguri add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Balaguri add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "One should as a rule respect public opinion in so far as is necessary to avoid starvation and to keep out of prison, but anything that goes beyond this is voluntary submission to an unnecessary tyranny, and is likely to interfere with happiness in all kinds of ways." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Balaguri add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "We know very little, and yet it is astonishing that we know so much, and still more astonishing that so little knowledge can give us so much power." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Balaguri add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "Is there any knowledge in the world which is so certain that no reasonable man could doubt it?" -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Balaguri add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "And if there were a God, I think it very unlikely that He would have such an uneasy vanity as to be offended by those who doubt His existence" -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Balaguri add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "I think that there is far too much work done in the world, that immense harm is caused by the belief that work is virtuous, and that what needs to be preached in modern industrial countries is quite different from what always has been preached." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Balaguri add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "Do not fear to be eccentric in opinion, for every opinion now accepted was once eccentric." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Balaguri add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "The cure for boredom is curiosity. There is no cure for curiosity." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Balaguri add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "I don't know much about being a millionaire, but I'll bet I'd be darling at it." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Balaguri add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "If I didn't care for fun and such, I'd probably amount to much. But I shall stay the way I am, Because I do not give a damn." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Balaguri add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Take care of the luxuries and the necessities will take care of themselves." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Balaguri add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "So, you're the man who can't spell 'fuck.'" Dorothy Parker to Norman Mailer after publishers had convinced Mailer to replace the word with a euphemism, 'fug,' in his 1948 book, "The Naked and the Dead." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Balaguri add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "A little bad taste is like a nice dash of paprika." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Balaguri add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Drink and dance and laugh and lie, Love, the reeling midnight through, For tomorrow we shall die! (But, alas, we never do.)" -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Balaguri add a quote by H.H. Munro
item.description: "A little inaccuracy sometimes saves a ton of explanation." -- H.H. Munro
